title: Scrum Master / Business Analyst
description:
**Scrum Master / Business Analyst**  

**Freelance / Contract**  

**Södertälje**  

**Hybrid 3 days a week**  

**7 month contract**  

**925 SEK / hour**

  

Our client is looking for a combined Scrum Master and Business Analyst. This hybrid role acts as a bridge between technical development and business needs. As a Scrum Master, you will facilitate agile ceremonies and ensure alignment with development priorities. In your capacity as a Business Analyst, you will gather requirements, analyze data, and ensure the analytics solution effectively supports business objectives. The solution is based on AWS.


You must have the right to work in Sweden without restrictions.

 **Key responsibilities**

*Agile Facilitation:*


Lead agile ceremonies such as stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives to keep the team focused and productive.

*Communication:*


Collaborate closely with stakeholders and the Value Chain Team (VCT) to gather and define requirements, ensuring alignment between business needs and technical solutions.


*Solution Implementation:*


Support the design, implementation, and reporting solutions using Power BI and Snowflake.


*Planning:*


Assist the team and work closely with the Product Owner (PO) before and during Program Increment (PI) planning (10-week program increments).


*Organizational Navigation:*


Navigate complex structures within a large organization, building relationships across departments to ensure effective communication and collaboration among diverse stakeholders.

**Key experience and qualifications required**


You must have all of the following experience and competencies, which must be evidenced in your CV:

* Data Transformation Tools: dbt
* Reporting Tool: Power BI
* Cloud Platform: Snowflake
* Programming Language: SQL

title: TECH LEAD VMWARE TILL BANKGIROT
description:
***En omvälvande transformation av betalsverige – där du behövs!***  



*Bankgirot söker nu en Tech Lead inom virtualisering till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm. Bankgirot har en unik ställning på Sveriges betalmarknad som nu genomgår den största transformationen i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation är i en tillväxtfas för att utveckla framtidssäkrade lösningar som följer internationell standard och regelverk. Samtidigt ser vi till att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar säkert och stabilt – varje dag.*

*Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalningsinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som Tech Lead inom virtualisering kommer du att spela en viktig roll i uppdraget att säkerställa framtidens betalningsinfrastruktur på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för uppdraget – och varandra.*

### **Din roll**


Du blir en central del av Bankgirots omfattande transformationsresa och får en nyckelroll i att bygga vår helt nya "Greenfield"-lösning för en framtidssäker betalningsinfrastruktur. Det här är en unik möjlighet för dig som vill vara med från grunden och skapa en modern plattform som formar Sveriges betalflöden.


Du ansvarar för design, implementering och optimering av vår virtualiseringsmiljö baserad på VMware Cloud Foundation. Här får du arbeta med avancerad teknik som Vsphere, Vsan, NSX och närliggande Kubernetes-lösningar, för att bygga en robust och skalbar plattform. Med ditt strategiska tänkande och tekniska expertis fungerar du som en sammanhållande länk mellan teknikteamet, driftorganisationen och utvecklingsavdelningen. Ditt arbete präglas av säkerhet och prestanda, och du ges möjligheten att sätta din prägel på en kritisk infrastruktur som gör skillnad. Dina ansvarsområden inkluderar:


* Med fokus på branschledande best practices inom design och arkitektur leder du tekniska projekt med precision
* Samordna installationer och säkerställa en smidig övergång från nuvarande infrastruktur
* Vara en coach och kunskapsbärare som stärker teamets kompetens och engagemang

### **Vi söker dig som har**


Vi söker dig med djup kunskap och erfarenhet av VMware Cloud Foundation, inklusive Vsphere, Vsan och NSX. Du har en passion för att skapa robusta och framtidssäkra virtualiseringslösningar och din erfarenhet inom IT-arkitektur och säkerhet på VMware-området gör dig till en trygg expert. Om du dessutom har erfarenhet av orkestrering, automation och integration med Kubernetes är det ett plus, eftersom dessa tekniker är centrala för vårt arbete med att bygga en modern infrastruktur.
  

  

För att trivas och lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har ledarskapserfarenhet och uppskattar en agil miljö där samarbete och innovation är i fokus. Din akademiska utbildning, eller motsvarande erfarenhet inom området, ger dig den tekniska bas som krävs för att möta både dagens och framtidens utmaningar. Tillsammans med ett engagerat team får du möjligheten att forma och driva utvecklingen av Bankgirots virtualiseringslösningar och bli en viktig del av vår transformation mot en framtidssäker betalningsinfrastruktur.


### **Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmåner**


Som vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter.
  

Vi satsar mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.




### **Övrig information**


Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.  

  

Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).

### **Intresserad?**


I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit. Vid frågor eller funderingar, kontakta Johanna Värmfors på Johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com, eller +46 730 821 230 eller Artan Bitiqi på artan.bitiqi@nexergroup.com, eller +46 723 61 28 44. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


### **Om Bankgirot**


Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar. Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Agil Projektledare SAP migrering
description:
**Agil Projektledare SAP migrering**  

**Konsultuppdrag**  

**Stockholm**  

**Flytande Svenska och engelska krävs**

  

Vår kund letar efter en agil projektledare för att leda arbetet med att migrera kundens SAP från on premise till Azure Cloud. Denna roll innebär ansvar för framgångsrik migrering av hela SAP-landskapet samt stöd införande av tjänster för plattformar och IT-drift. Leveransen kommer att utföras av kundens egna team tillsammans med leverantörer. Rollen innebär planering, exekvering och ett operativt ledarskap för att leda det dagliga arbetet.


Du ska ha erfarenhet av **agil projektledning inom IT**, med kunskaper i processer för IT drift, incidenthantering och molnmiljöer. Erfarenhet av och kunskap om SAP system samt erfarenhet av att flytta SAP till cloud är ett krav. Erfarenhet av att upphandla drift- och migreringspartners är meriterande.

**Språkkrav**

  

Flytande svenska och god engelska.

 **Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**

*Planering och ledarskap*

* Kommunicerar mål i form av VAD och VARFÖR
* Utveckla och kommunicera planer som specificerar tidslinjer, milstolpar och leverabler. Du utvecklar planer tillsammans med de som exekverar arbetet.
* Leda tvärfunktionella team för att garantera framgångsrik leverans och nå kundens mål.
* Skapar en kultur baserat på förtroende och öppenhet där hinder lyfts och det är lätt att be om hjälp.
* Leda och arbeta inom en skalad agil modell baserad på SAFe.
* Säkerställa att agila principer och praxis följs.

*Flytta SAP till Azure*

* Säkerställa att SAP migreras till Cloud med uppfyllda mål
* Säkerställa ett fungerande samarbete mellan kundens team och leverantörer
* Säkra att samarbete kring uppsättning av målmiljö och förmågor för migrering fungerar

*Införa tjänster och processer*

* Leda införande av tjänster för plattformar, ny operativmodell samt utvecklade processer för IT-drift.
* Säkerställa övergången till ny operativa modell med interna team och externa partners

**Nödvändig kompetens**

  

Du måste ha all följande erfarenhet och kompetens, vilken måste framgå av din CV:

* Erfarenhet av att migrera stora affärskritiska system till Azure eller andra molnplattformar är ett krav.
* Erfarenhet av upphandling och leverantörshantering.
* Mycket goda färdigheter i kommunikation och dokumentation.
* Lång erfarenhet av projektledning av IT i agila organisationer, särskilt med fokus på infrastruktur, drift och molnlösningar.
* Kunskap om IT-drift i molnmiljöer med tillhörande processer.
* Erfarenhet av att leda agila iteam, särskilt inom en skalad agil modell.
* Lång erfarenhet av ledarskap och förändringsledning inom IT.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en skalad agil modell (t.ex. SAFe, LeSS) från flera företag.
* Flytande i både svenska och engelska för effektiv kommunikation med olika intressenter.

**Värdefull kompetens**


Följande erfarenhet och kompetens gör att du står ut och måste framgå av din CV:

* Erfarenhet från rollen som scrum master är meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av SAP är meriterande

title: Senior Manager, Solution Success
description:
Flexera saves customers billions of dollars in wasted technology spend. A pioneer in Hybrid ITAM and FinOps, Flexera provides award-winning, data-oriented SaaS solutions for technology value optimization (TVO), enabling IT, finance, procurement and cloud teams to gain deep insights into cost optimization, compliance and risks for each business service. Flexera One solutions are built on a set of definitive customer, supplier and industry data, powered by our Technology Intelligence Platform, that enables organizations to visualize their Enterprise Technology Blueprint™ in hybrid environments—from on-premises to SaaS to containers to cloud.
We’re transforming the software industry. We’re Flexera. With more than 50,000 customers across the world, we’re achieving that goal. But we know we can’t do any of that without our team. Ready to help us re-imagine the industry during a time of substantial growth and ambitious plans? Come and see why we’re consistently recognized by Gartner, Forrester and IDC as a category leader in the marketplace. Learn more at flexera.com
Reporting to the International Solution Success Director, covering EMEA and APAC, the Senior Manager for Solution Success will manage a team of Solution Success Managers. These individuals will be geographically spread across multiple regions such as the Nordics, India and Australia.
This is a vital role that requires strong management of a high performing team focused on customer retention and customer growth. The team will have personal customer portfolios that will role up to a team portfolio for the successful applicant.
Responsibilities of the role include, but are not limited to the following:
Portfolio Management:* Review all accounts in current portfolio covering risk status, value realization plans, and impact (Quarterly).
* Identify and discuss accounts to be added or removed from individual portfolio (Quarterly).
* Finalize portfolio changes with management and submit to commissions team (Quarterly).
* Maintain list and coverage plan of unassigned accounts (Weekly).
* Provide temporary coverage for accounts that are unassigned or SSM is on leave (As Needed).


Value Realization:* Review and provide coaching in the creation and sharing of Value Realization (Weekly).
* Facilitate enablement and certification of team on Value Realization processes such as Outcome Workshops, Value Realization Plans and Verified Outcomes (Monthly).
* Monitor Value Realization dashboard and action on missed KPIs (Weekly).


Risk Mitigation:* Review weekly risk updates submitted in Gainsight and flag any accounts that require escalation or additional help (Weekly).
* Follow up on action items from weekly leadership risk review with Solution Success Managers (Weekly).
* Engage directly with high-risk accounts in collaboration with the Solution Success Managers (Weekly).
* Support annual budgeting process in partnership with Renewals (Bi-Yearly).


Team Management & Development:* Hold weekly O3s (1-2-1 meetings) with all direct reports to exchange feedback and discuss work and outcomes. In addition, support direct reports in created personalizing goals based on cascaded organizational targets.
* Host regular team meetings and other spaces for collaboration, discussion and feedback.
* Maintain up to date documentation of processes and best practices in CS Book (internal reference site).
* Maintain close alignment and regular communication with internal stakeholders such as Sales, Professional Services, Support and Renewals.
* Communicate Solution Success org changes (accounts, staffing, processes, priorities) to the rest of Flexera.
* Review and approve requests for training, certification and professional development based on budgets/justification.
* Complete annual reviews for merit and promotion recommendations.


Flexera is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered for open roles regardless of age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local/national laws, policies and/or regulations.
Flexera understands the value that results from employing a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce. We recognize that equity necessitates acknowledging past exclusion and that inclusion requires intentional effort. Our DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion) council is the driving force behind our commitment to championing policies and practices that foster a welcoming environment for all.
We encourage candidates requiring accommodations to please let us know by emailing careers@flexera.com.
company_description: For over 30 years, our 1,300+ team members worldwide have been passionate about helping our more than 20,000 customers fuel business success.

title: Marketing Automation Coordinator | Booztlet
description:
**Marketing Automation Coordinator | Booztlet**

 **THE OPPORTUNITY**


Are you looking to start or grow your career in marketing with a focus on CRM and automation?


We are excited to welcome an enthusiastic Marketing Automation Coordinator to the Booztlet CRM & Marketing Automation team.


As a Marketing Automation Coordinator, you will handle a big part of the daily email, App, and SMS marketing execution, and work closely with and learn from specialists on the field, and with cross-department teams.


Join a supportive, collaborative, and innovative team where your ideas and professional development are valued. Working with Salesforce Marketing Cloud, we are shaping the future of marketing automation using customer data to build efficient, impactful solutions. Our team takes pride in being a close-knit unit, dedicated to the success of Booztlet.com — a 100% eCommerce B2C retailer with ambitions to become THE Nordic outlet. We see ourselves as entrepreneurs who work across channels to increase revenue from existing customers.


Here with us you will gain hands-on experience with MarTech and learn from seasoned professionals. If you're eager to learn, grow, and contribute to cutting-edge marketing campaigns, this is the perfect opportunity for you.  

  

  



**WHAT YOU WILL DO**

  

* Executing daily email sends, SMS and APP push communications
* Test before sending it out to make sure all elements of the email communication look as planned and that links are linking to the correct landing pages
* Select planned segments for each email and schedule the send-out in the email system
* Assist our Marketing Automation Specialists in monitoring, analyzing & reporting on campaigns
* Assist in testing hypotheses (A/B test) & optimization of customer communication
* Create and maintain vouchers
* Help out with “Bugs and ASAP’s” to support the daily business

 **YOUR PROFILE**

  

To be successful in this role you are interested in marketing automation and data-driven marketing. You are a proactive team player who can perform and make things happen in a fast-paced environment. You are detail-oriented, structured, responsible, and open to testing new ideas.


* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or related field
* Basic knowledge of CRM & Marketing Automation with a willingness to learn
* Strong communication skills
* A positive, “no tech-fear” attitude
* You work fluently in English since this is our corporate language (only applications in English will be considered)

 *Please apply for this position as soon as possible as we work with ongoing selection and interviews.*

 **Note**; Only applications submitted in English will be considered.


The first mandatory step in our recruitment process includes two assessments (behavioral and cognitive) which will be emailed separately. If you have already completed them, you may skip this step.

 **We look forward to receiving your application!**

  

  

  

**BOOZT PERKS**

* Great personal and internal career development
* A culture that incorporates our values of trust, freedom, and responsibility
* Flexible work environment
* Driven and passionate international colleagues
* A generous employee discount
* Wellness allowance and sports activities, HQ onsite masseuse and medical doctor

**A LITTLE BIT ABOUT US**


We are one of the leading e-commerce players in the Nordics. We offer our customers fashion, kids, sports, beauty, and home on Boozt.com and Booztlet.com. You can find our headquarters in Malmö, Sweden, our Boozt Innovation Lab in the heart of Copenhagen, a data science team in Aarhus, Denmark, our two tech offices in Vilnius, Lithuania, and in Poznan, Poland, and our fully automated warehouse in Ängelholm (one of the worlds biggest AutoStores). Our Boozt family consists of +1100 employees from more than 60+ nationalities; we believe that our diverse teams help us build an innovative and vibrant workplace. Would you like to join us on our exciting journey?


We are an equal opportunity employer, that embraces diversity and inclusiveness.
company_description: We want to reimagine how we shop today and tomorrow while working to deliver an outstanding online shopping experience and making Boozt the leading responsible e-commerce company in the Nordics.

title: Global Chief Commercial Officer
description:
Net Insight is seeking a Global Chief Commercial Officer to drive business growth and strengthen our leadership in media network solutions. As CCO, you’ll advance our global go-to-market (GTM) strategy, lead our sales and marketing organization, and expand our presence in new customer segments and markets. You will develop and inspire a high-performing team, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and trust within a pioneering media technology company.


Join us in shaping the future of media!


**ABOUT THE POSITION**  

As CCO, you will play a strategic role in guiding our media sales organization toward growth and long-term success. Key responsibilities include:


* Developing and implementing GTM strategies that align with our growth goals.
* Building trust and strong relationships with key customers, collaborating closely with the CEO, Executive Management Team, and Board.
* Leading our global media sales teams to achieve profitability and commercial excellence, building a culture centred on innovation, collaboration and trust.
* Overseeing reporting, budgeting, forecasting and KPIs focused on revenue growth and profitability.

You’ll lead a global team of approximately 40 professionals, including three regional VPs of Sales (EMEA, Americas, APAC) and the Head of Sales Business Development. Additionally, you’ll be responsible for marketing strategy with our Global Head of Marketing, ensuring cohesive, cross-functional alignment toward shared goals.


**ABOUT YOU**  

We’re looking for a forward-thinking leader with extensive experience in leading senior sales roles, ideally in global B2B and technology-driven markets. You are a change agent who:


* Embraces new methods to enhance commercial excellence and customer engagement.
* Builds credibility and trust with customers, partners, and team members.
* Leads by example, fostering collaboration across teams and geographies.
* Transforms complexity into clear, actionable strategies for growth.

**Key Qualifications:**

* University degree in Business, Technology, or equivalent.
* 10+ years in global sales leadership, ideally within Media, Telecom, or Digital Communication sectors.
* Proven experience in developing and executing global GTM strategies.
* Proven success in leading and scaling global sales teams with a focus on commercial excellence and growth.
* Experience in a management team role and in listed company environments is advantageous.
* Fluent in English

**WHY CHOOSE US?**  

At Net Insight, you’ll play a high-impact role in shaping our GTM strategy and driving global customer engagement. You’ll collaborate with passionate, forward-thinking professionals who are committed to pushing boundaries and embracing change. Together, as one team, you’ll drive growth, contributing to our collective success.


Join us in shaping the future of Media!


**WELCOME TO APPLY**  

The position is permanent, full-time employment located in our headquarters in Solna. We value work-life balance; therefore, you can combine remote work and work from the office.


For more information about the position, please contact Head of HR Tove Bylund at: tove.bylund@netinsight.net.  



  

**ABOUT NET INSIGHT**

*Net Insight (Nasdaq: NETI B) provides the highest performing, most open video transport and media cloud technology for content providers as the industry standard for flexibility and service across live contribution, distribution and remote production media workflows.*

*For over 25 years, the world’s leading content owners, broadcasters, production companies, service providers and enterprises have trusted Net Insight’s Emmy Award winning Nimbra technology to guarantee media delivery. Today, Net Insight partners with hundreds of customers in over 70 countries to ensure media flows across managed and unmanaged IP networks, and the cloud – from anywhere, to everywhere. It enables customers to get the best from any mix of virtualized, cloud and IP technology and is the only platform to support all the major industry standards, protocols and clouds.*

*Welcome to Net Insight, where* ***innovation****,* ***collaboration****, and* ***trust*** *are the cornerstones of our success. As one team, we are committed to delivering value to our customers, contributing to the growth and success of our company. Together we create a dynamic and positive workplace where everyone is valued, engaged and empowered to make an impact*

title: Service Managers till Apotek Hjärtat
description:
Är du redo att göra skillnad för människors hälsa och påverka över 50 miljoner kundmöten varje år? Apotek Hjärtat genomgår just nu en spännande förändring där vi moderniserar våra tekniska plattformar för att bättre stödja våra medarbetare och leva upp till våra kunders höga förväntningar och söker nu två Service Managers.

 **Om rollen som Service Manager:**


Som Service Manager på Hjärtat kommer du att spela en central roll i att förvalta system som optimerar arbetsprocesserna i våra apotek och e-handelslager. Du kommer att vara systemägare för våra kritiska system och arbeta nära våra leverantörer för att säkerställa att de lever upp till våra krav, samt följa upp incidenter och rotorsaksanalyser. Vidare kommer du att hantera systemleveranser, inklusive förändringshantering och informationsspridning, både internt och externt. Du kommer också att vara delaktig i avtalsprocesser (SLA och serviceavtal), samt stötta budgetarbetet och säkerställa att beslutade aktiviteter genomförs. Vi söker just nu två Service Managers till avdelningarna Commerse och Logistics.

 **Commer****c****e:** IT-domänen Commerce består av cirka 30 engagerade kollegor som är baserade i Solna. Tillsammans ansvarar vi för att planera, leverera och förvalta både köpta och egenutvecklade system inom vårt område som syftar till att förbättra kundupplevelsen över alla försäljningskanaler. Här kommer du arbeta med system så som POS, receptexpediering och vår e-handelsplattform och i uppstarten kommer du ha en nyckelroll i att bygga upp arbetet med drift och förvaltning av POS. Placeringsort är i Solna.

 **Logistics****:**IT-domänen Logistics består av cirka 15 engagerade kollegor som är baserade i Solna och i Norrköping. Tillsammans ansvarar vi för att planera, leverera och förvalta både köpta och egenutvecklade system inom vårt område som syftar till att optimera och utveckla vår varuförsörjning till våra apotek och slutkunder. Du kommer att arbeta med system som t.ex. Order Management, Warehouse Management, Warehouse Control System, Goods Management, Last Mile och Robotautomation. Du kommer att arbeta nära verksamheten för att stödja våra processer på bästa sätt. Placeringsort är Solna men resor till och från Norrköping kommer att ingå i rollen.

 **Vem är du?**


Vi söker dig som har ca 5 års erfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter, antingen i en linjebefattning eller som konsult. Du har också en högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande med relevant inriktning.

  

För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har erfarenhet av:

* Att arbeta med IT-processer enligt ITIL, särskilt Incident Management, Problem Management och Root Cause Analysis.
* Avtalsarbete och uppföljning av SLA.
* Större systemleverantörer för WMS, POS, ehandel eller receptexpediering.
* Att arbeta med internationella aktörer och översätta deras lösningar till Apotek Hjärtats dagliga behov.
* Molntjänster som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud Platform.
* Applikationsdrift och bred IT-kunskap.
 **Egenskaper vi värdesätter:**


Du är noggrann, kvalitetsmedveten och har en utmärkt förmåga att bygga och upprätthålla både interna och externa relationer. Du är bra på att hantera både taktiska frågor och operativa uppgifter. Du leder dig själv och andra med ett strategiskt tänkesätt och tar samtidigt hand om de praktiska detaljerna i ditt arbete.

  

För denna roll är det viktigt att du kan uttrycka dig obehindrat både på svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.

 **Vad händer nu?**


Välkommen med din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast den 29e november. Urval sker löpande. Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta rekryterande chef, Sammi Khayer på 070-7878 098 eller Peter Skarin på 070 241 27 90. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta rekryterare Josefine Claeson 076 105 78 68.

  

Hos Apotek Hjärtat strävar vi efter att spegla våra kunder och samhället. Vi välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och perspektiv. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.  

Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Azure Engineer
description:
**Role Description** 




 This is a contract Azure Engineer role located on-site in Stockholm. As an Azure Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining Azure cloud infrastructure. Your day-to-day tasks will involve deploying Azure solutions, monitoring system performance, and troubleshooting issues to ensure optimal cloud services for our clients.
 



  





**Requirements** 





 • Azure Certified Administrator
 





 • Azure Certified Security Engineer
 





 • Deeper Knowledge in Backup, Storage and Patching activities of Azure resources
 





 • Deeper knowledge of cost optimization in Azure
 





 • Good to have experience in Azure Kubernetes

title: Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientists
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, tax, and related services. During its 175-year history, our organization has grown tremendously in both scale and capabilities. Deloitte currently has approximately 415,000 people in more than 150 countries and territories, and serves four out of five Fortune Global 500® companies. Yet, our shared culture and mission—to make an impact that matters—remains unchanged. This is evident not only in Deloitte’s work for clients, but also in our WorldClass ambition, our WorldClimate initiative and our ALL IN diversity and inclusion strategy.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

**Are you ready for the next step in your career and join our team in Sweden?**




 Deloitte's business area Technology & Transformation is a market leader in Sweden and works together with decision-makers in both global and local organizations. We support organizations in their challenges regarding strategy issues and in the implementation of complex transformations that often include major business-driven IT changes.
   

  

  





 Our AI & Data team is now looking for additional data scientists (Senior Consultant to Senior Manager levels). As a data scientist on our AI & Data team, you’ll use the power of advanced analytics, machine learning and GenAI to uncover valuable insights and drive impactful, data-driven decisions for our clients. Your role will involve developing and deploying statistical and machine learning models, translating complex findings into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders, and leading technical implementation projects. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that our solutions are aligned with business objectives and staying at the forefront of the latest advancements in data science. You can expect to be working with hands-on implementation tasks as well as being in advisory roles in relation to data science assignments. When not on projects you are expected to be available for proposal work and answering RFPs, do additional training or help with business development tasks.
   

  

  




**Qualifications**

**Key Responsibilities**



* Work closely with clients to understand their business objectives and identify opportunities where data science can provide insights or automated decision making.
* Implement advanced analytics, machine learning and GenAI solutions based on our frameworks and best practices within data science.
* Advise clients in how to become insight driven organizations.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, cloud engineers, data analysts and business analysts, to deliver comprehensive solutions.
* Stay current with the latest trends and technologies in data science and apply them to client engagements.
* For the senior levels there are also expectations on having a strong business acumen, actively participate in sales-related activities such as working with proposals, attend client sales meetings etc., as well as acting as a leader to more junior data scientist colleagues. For the Senior Manager role we are looking for a team leader.


**Qualifications**
* Master’s degree in data science, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or other similar and relevant educational background.
* 3+ years of work experience in data science or other related roles.
* Proficiency in data science tools and languages such as Python and SQL.
* Experiences with Databricks, Snowflake and/or any hyperscaler (GCP, Azure or AWS) is a plus. For the right person we can also offer a role to lead one of our alliances.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* You live and work in Sweden, preferably in Stockholm.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


**Additional Information**

**We offer** 
  

 At Deloitte we focus on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths. By on-the-job learning experiences, formal development programs at Deloitte University and support from a personal coach, you will have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout your career.
   

  

**The way of working at Deloitte – our commitment to you** 
  

  

**At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture** 
 where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture.
   

  

 Our role is to
 **unlock potential for growth and innovation** 
 . We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions.
   

  

 We often
 **work hand-in-hand with our clients** 
 to help find the right solution and to help to apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we have started.
   

  

**How to apply** 
  

 Your application should consist of a CV and a cover letter and you apply directly online.
   

  

 As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/
   

  

**Questions?** 
  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Patric Barenthin pbarenthin@deloitte.se. For questions regarding the application process, please contact Sophie Karlerö, skarlero@deloitte.se.
   

  

  





  

**We are looking forward to your application!** 
  

  

*For further information on Deloitte, please visit www.deloitte.se*




**What impact will you make?**




 På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnad för andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. På Deloitte hittar du tidigare dolda möjligheter att lyckas och inser din fulla potential.

title: Azure Architect
description:
**Job Title: Azure Architect** 




**Job Type: Contract** 




**Job Location: Stockholm Sweden** 




  





**Description:** 




 We are seeking an experienced Azure Architect. As an Azure Architect, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and optimize Azure solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform specifically tailored to Dynamics 365 applications. You will work closely with our development, operations, and security teams to create scalable, highly available, and secure architectures.
 



  





 The ideal candidate should have a deep understanding of Azure services, strong architecture design skills, and a track record of successful Azure projects. Work closely together with the solution architects/Leads in the Dynamics 365 F&O CoE team to make sure we create global solution as per guardrails.
 



  





**Responsibilities and skills:** 




 ·        Design and implement scalable and highly available solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform.
 



 ·        Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define architectural requirements and develop solutions that align with business goals.
 



 ·        Create and maintain Azure architecture documentation, diagrams, and best practices.
 



 ·        Provide expertise in areas such as Azure Virtual Machines, Azure App Services, Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database, Azure Networking, and Azure Active Directory.
 



 ·        Ensure compliance with security and governance policies while architecting solutions.
 



 ·        Develop and implement cost optimization strategies for Azure resources.
 



 ·        Troubleshoot and resolve complex issues related to Azure infrastructure and services.
 



 ·        Stay updated with the latest Azure features, services, and industry best practices.
 



 ·        Microsoft Azure certifications, such as Azure Solutions Architect Expert or Azure DevOps Engineer Expert.
 



 ·        Proven experience designing and implementing Azure solutions.
 



 ·        Strong knowledge of Azure services and features.
 



 ·        Familiarity with infrastructure as code (IaC) tools like Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates.
 



 ·        Proficiency in scripting and automation using tools such as PowerShell or Azure CLI.
 



 ·        Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
 



 ·        Experience with DevOps and CI/CD pipelines in Azure.
 



 ·        Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.

title: Team Manager - Online Fraud Prevention
description:
**Job Description**
 To provide a secure, trustworthy, and always available experience to our customers, we are now transforming the way we address the continuously evolving and complex cyber security threats and risks. To do this we have created a new Tech Centre focused solely on managing Cyber Security for all our brands and majority investments. Within this Cyber Security Tech Centre, we have a unit that focuses on Cyber Security Engineering, with the mission to protect our customers, colleagues, and company by establishing and managing safe and secure technology use.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to lead one of our Global Engineering teams, focused on Cyber crime and
 **Online Fraud Prevention** 
 to drive our delivery and services portfolio throughout the whole H&M Group and all our brands. You will report to the Head of Cyber Security Engineering Unit.
   

  

 We are looking for a strong
 **Manage** 
 r and principal leader within B2C Online e-commerce Fraud prevention who can drive our delivery and services portfolio.
   

  

 You will ensure that core capabilities are in place to manage Cybercrime, online Fraud and Loss prevention. You will grow and mature the internal and external organisation, from individual team members to our managed services partners. You will drive risk management work related to the Cybercrime area, improve the security posture to meet current and emerging threats, and proactively work with compliance to policies and regulations. More specifically you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Manage day-to-day activities of the Online Fraud Prevention team, ensuring operational and performance objectives are met.
* Spear-head team-level budgeting, planning, and roadmap initiatives.
* Cultivate professional development within the team to ensure relevant skills and qualifications.
* Navigate stakeholder relationships to align Fraud Prevention with business needs, regulatory requirements, and company policies.
* Contribute to the Cyber Security strategy and ensure team alignment.
* Respond to audit findings, prioritize remediation measures, and manage your team's budget, including staff, contracts, and technology.
* Identify demands, objectives, and key results, defining and monitoring supporting KPIs and metrics.
* Ensure the availability, stability, and performance of Cybercrime and Online Fraud prevention services.
* Assess and manage risks to the effectiveness of platforms and services, protecting against current and emerging threats.


**Qualifications**
 We envision you as a seasoned leader with experience in a Leadership role, preferably within retail or e-commerce, deploying modern technologies in large, complex organizations. Key attributes include:
   

  

* Have a background in leading online e-commerce Fraud Prevention teams for B2C, specializing in areas such as payments fraud, chargeback rates reduction, discount abuse, gift card abuse, account takeovers, and e-commerce fraud attacks.
* Creative and critical thinking, offering ideas and solutions to ongoing challenges.
* A track record of successful Cybercrime, Online Fraud, and Loss prevention deliveries in complex global environments.
* Experience in leading a team that designs, implements, and deploys Cybercrime and Online Fraud prevention solutions.
* Working hands-on experience in areas such as cybercrime, online fraud, loss prevention, cyber forensics investigations, or proactive pattern recognitions.
* End-to-end project delivery experience with hands-on involvement in product development for Cybercrime and online Fraud prevention.
* Experience with at least one major cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Leadership understanding of team dynamics and staff personal development.
* A bachelor's degree in a related field.
* Preferred certifications: CISSP, CISM, CompTia Security+, Identity Management Institute (IMI) certifications.


 Above all, we value your passion, pride in achievements, and the ability to share this enthusiasm with your colleagues.
   

  

**Benefits**
**Additional Information**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: Account Executive, Enterprise (Sweden)
company_industry: Computer Hardware Manufacturing and Software Development
description:
**BE PART OF BUILDING THE FUTURE.**
 What do NASA and emerging space companies have in common with COVID vaccine R&D teams or with Roblox and the Metaverse?
   

  

 The answer is data, -- all fast moving, fast growing industries rely on data for a competitive edge in their industries. And the most advanced companies are realizing the full data advantage by partnering with Pure Storage. Pure’s vision is to redefine the storage experience and empower innovators by simplifying how people consume and interact with data. With 11,000+ customers including 58% of the Fortune 500, we’ve only scratched the surface of our ambitions.
   

  

**Pure Is Blazing Trails And Setting Records**
* For ten straight years, Gartner has named Pure a leader in the Magic Quadrant
* Our customer-first culture and unwavering commitment to innovation have earned us a certified Net Promoter Score in the top 1% of B2B companies globally
* Industry analysts and press applaud Pure’s leadership across these dimensions
* And, our 5,000+ employees are emboldened to make Pure a faster, stronger, smarter company as we go


 If you, like us, say “bring it on” to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.
   

  

**SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE...**
 Pure Storage is seeking an experienced Account Executive to join the Enterprise Sales team in Sweden. In this role, you will be responsible for prospecting and
 **developing business with new customers** 
 selling the full portfolio of PURE’s offerings, within the
 **Banking and Finance** 
 sectors. You will work with our channel resellers in an indirect sales motion and interact directly with key customer accounts. You will also collaborate with the Sales, Pre-sales, Partner sales, and Field Marketing team to develop business with new and existing customers in the assigned account list.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing...**
* Evangelize our radically simple, all-flash enterprise storage technology and data solutions, ensuring customers fully grasp Pure’s total value proposition
* Build and invest in relationships with customers to establish Pure’s value, continually driving the highest customer satisfaction ratings in the industry
* Lead pursuit teams and develop account plans to make sure all internal resources are engaged to execute and win new Pure Customers
* Drive and manage a healthy and robust pipeline of sales activity to assure quarterly and annual quotas are met or exceeded
* Work closely with a network of Channel, GSI and Ecosystem Partners to successfully position and sell the Pure Storage platform in your assigned accounts.
* Create and execute account strategies and coordinate team selling efforts with partners to accurately forecast and close business on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis.
* Deliver results; exceeding annual quotas, driving referenceable business and building consistent pipeline through effective prospecting and marketing initiatives.
* Develop and present comprehensive proposals to customers, articulating the business outcomes and benefits to be realized with the Pure Storage platform.
* You will always be earning the right to be our customers & partners first choice.


**What You’ll Need To Bring To This Role...**
* Enterprise SaaS sales experience highly desirable.
* Passion for sales and business development with a team spirit, relationship building and customer business outcome focused.
* Solid experience with Enterprise accounts.
* A Banking & Finance sector focus.
* Proven experience working closely with a network of Channel, GSI and Ecosystem Partners to successfully position, market and sell the Pure Storage platform in your assigned accounts.
* Advanced prospection skills with an excellent capacity to engage with new customers
* An ambitious/goal-oriented attitude, a strong work ethic, a desire to disrupt the status quo, drive change and evangelize new technologies.
* Proven track record in delivering results; exceeding annual quotas, driving referenceable business and building consistent pipeline through effective prospecting and marketing initiatives.
* The ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment is key, a blend of large company and startup experience.
* Knowledge of the cloud computing industry & data management, or current and next-generation business applications, predominantly on customer premises with cloud storage understanding.
* An understanding of the overall Data Centre Architecture including Fabric, Network, Virtual Server and virtual desktop environments, databases and disaster recovery.
* Excellent time management and communication skills.
* Proficient with Salesforce.com and Google Workspace (preferred, not required).
* Minimum of 8-10 years of field sales experience.
* Must be willing and able to work in an open office, team environment.
* Native/Bilingual Swedish and business professional English Required.


**BE YOU—CORPORATE CLONES NEED NOT APPLY.**
 Pure is where you ask big questions, think differently, and make an impact. This is not just a job, but a place where you have a voice and can accelerate your career. We value unique thoughts and celebrate individuality, and with ample opportunity to learn, develop yourself, and expand into different roles, joining Pure is an investment in your career journey.
   

  

 Through our Pure Equality program, which supports a flourishing field of employee resource groups, we nourish the personal and professional lives of our team members. And our Pure Good Foundation gives back to local and global communities through volunteering and grants.
   

  

 And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources, and company-sponsored team events.
   

  

**PURE IS COMMITTED TO EQUALITY.**
 Research shows that in order to apply for a job, women feel they need to meet 100% of the criteria while men usually apply after meeting about 60%. Regardless of how you identify, if you believe you can do the job and are a good match, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

 Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire.
   

  

 If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at
 **TA-Ops@purestorage.com** 
 .
   

  

**APPLICANT & CANDIDATE PERSONAL INFORMATION PRIVACY NOTICE.**
 If you're wondering how or why Pure collects or uses information you provide, we invite you to check out our Applicant & Candidate Personal Information Protection Notice.
   

  

**DEEMED EXPORT LICENSE NOTICE.**
 Some positions may require a deemed export license for compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Please note: Pure does not currently sponsor deemed export license applications so we are unable to proceed with applicants requiring stated sponsorship.

title: Security Engineer
description:
**Start****14-12-2024****Duration****4-6 months**
  
emagine is loogin for a Senior Security Enginee for a very exciting assignment.

**Start**: 2024-12-15

**Duration**: Until further notice

**Location**: Must be based in Stockholm and open to be at the office when needed

**About the role:**


The Identity and Access Management team manages the lifecycle of identities for authentication and authorization within our organization, as well as overseeing Access Governance. Essentially, we develop the software that controls who should have access to what resources across the company.


One of the key software tools we use for this purpose is SailPoint IdentityIQ.


We aim to make substantial improvements in how we work with SailPoint IIQ and may eventually migrate to the SailPoint Identity Security Center.


This role’s primary focus will be as a SailPoint IIQ Subject Matter Expert (SME), working directly with SailPoint IIQ code. This person will also be part of a larger team handling all aspects of identity and access management.


They’re expected to engage in discussions, collaborate closely with others, share their expertise, contribute to other software projects, and be an active team member—this is not a siloed role.


We encourage a coding-first approach to solutions and system configuration.


For this role, we require a candidate who is first and foremost a strong software engineer and coder. We avoid solutions that depend on manual operations and therefore are not seeking candidates who are strictly system operators or sysadmins.

**Candidates should be at a senior level or possess high-level skills with significant experience in:**

* SailPoint IIQ
* Java (JavaBeans)
* Building software systems outside of SailPoint

**Additionally, experience with the following is a plus:**

* Python (our primary language for services outside SailPoint)
* JavaScript / TypeScript (we plan to build several user-facing applications)
* AL / LLM (we aim to leverage LLMs in several of our products)
* SailPoint ISC
* Infrastructure as Code / Configuration as Code

title: Thesis APDL Configurable Beam Model GUI 2025
description:
**Do you want to help us speed up the shift towards a more sustainable mining and construction industry? By doing your thesis in collaboration with Epiroc you will get the chance to be a part of this journey.**  


You will work together with experienced and helpful colleagues in an atmosphere characterized by creativity, innovation, and workplace diversity. In your specific project you have the chance to be a part of a challenging and educational experience while growing both professionally and personally.  

**Education background:**  

Mechanical engineering/Software engineer and programming language APDL
**Level of thesis project:**  

Bachelor/Master Thesis
**Number of students in the project:**  

One or two students/project.  

**Target:**  

This project is intended to create a template for a beam model for the analysis engineers. This will involve creating a GUI that the engineers can use which utilizes in APDL (Ansys Programming Design Language). The goal is for the analysis team to be able to quickly create a model of a boom without the hassle of writing the APDL code itself.  


**Background:**  

Currently, whenever an order is made and we should test the structural strength of a boom, we need to sit down and write the code (almost) from scratch. Usually, we have previous models that we can lean back on and start from, but it will still take some time. The quicker we can get this model (pre-processing) done the quicker we can get to actual results that determine whether an order is feasible or not.  


**Mission:**  

The desirable outcome is for the project to produce a configurable beam model in APDL using a simplified GUI. One such “program” that involves us to choose a set of degrees of freedom and input the boom parameters (such as boom body, telescope, feeder etc with material properties relating to each parameter).  


**Qualification:**  

The students should have some knowledge in graphical interface design and programming language. Mechanical engineering knowledge is meritorious, but the team already have the mechanical knowledge. We do not currently have the appropriate coding capabilities.  

  

**How to apply:**  

Does this sound interesting, and do you feel this is a match?  

  

Log in to the recruitment system. If you are new to the system, you need to start by making a profile. Do not forget to attach your CV and a short letter about your-self, describing why you are applying for this thesis. Please note that we do not accept applications via email.  


In this process, we review applications continuously and the project can be filled before last day of application. We recommend to send your application in as soon possible, **but no later than December 9th.**  

  

For information or questions please contact hiring manager: Emma Petersson, emma.petersson@epiroc.com  



**It all starts with people.** The world needs metals and minerals for the energy transition and our cities and infrastructure must be developed to serve a growing population. To succeed, we need to speed up the shift towards more sustainable mining and construction industries. We at Epiroc accelerate this transformation, together with customers and business partners in more than 150 countries, by developing and providing innovative and safe equipment, digital solutions, and aftermarket support.
All new thinkers are welcome. We are looking for those who want to develop, grow, and dare to think new. In Epiroc we attract, develop, and retain diverse talent valuing authenticity and unique perspectives, driving our spirit of innovation. We foster an inclusive culture where diversity isn't just a goal but a part of our values and way of working. This is how we do business for a sustainable future. Learn more at www.epiroc.com

title: Experienced Test Automation Engineer\u007C SEB, Stockholm
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with a technology function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you looking for a meaningful challenge and an opportunity to grow? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!* **What you will be doing?**
You will join the Test Release and Platform team, focusing on full-flow automation and regression tests in the payments area. You will work in a Cross-Functional Agile team, collaborating across teams to deliver high-priority flows and help shape modern payment solutions. **Responsibilities**
As a Test Automation engineer, you will:* Work and collaborate with your team colleagues to identify, implement, and maintain full-flow automated tests.
* Assist development teams and testers in following test automation processes to ensure that long-term strategies and best practices are implemented.
* Define and document test flows to ensure automated processes are clear and accessible for users and team members.
* Create and maintain test metrics.
* Manage and enhance Continuous Integration (CI) processes
* Participate in the daily SCRUM process.

 **Who we are looking for**
We’re looking for a proactive problem-solver who takes ownership of their work, thrives in a team environment, and is eager to learn and share insights with others.  

You have experience in software quality assurance or a related area. And you’re willing to work with different test automation tools and learn new test automation frameworks. **Required skills:** *Must have skills:** Experience in developing and implementing test automation frameworks.
* Experience with UI test automation (preferably Selenium Webdriver, WebdriverIO, Playwright)
* Experience with a tool for API test automation (e.g. Ready API, RestSharp, Rest Assured)
* SQL/database testing skills
* Knowledge of .NET, Java, or equivalent scripting languages (e.g., JavaScript)

 *Nice-to-have skills:** Experience with test management tools and integrating them in Test Automation (Xray preferred)
* Knowledge of CI integration tools (e.g.GitHub Actions and/or Jenkins)
* Familiarity with SDLC, Agile principles, and testing methodologies

 *Personal attributes** Strong interest in staying up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in Test Automation.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* A passion for automating processes and simplifying tasks

  

We encourage you to apply if you don’t meet every requirement listed but are excited about this role. **What we offer:*** Extensive training opportunities and access to exclusive staff benefits.
* A varied role where you'll build our new platform and take end-to-end responsibility for regulatory use cases.
* Join a supportive team that values cooperation, innovation, and work-life balance.
* Hybrid workplace setup.

 **Ready to join?**
Please attach your CV and a brief cover letter explaining why you’re the ideal candidate for this role. Apply today—applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis until **2024-11-30**.  

If you have questions about the position, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner, Rasmus Hallberg, at rasmus.hallberg@seb.se

title: Electrical Engineer
description:
**About xpertec:**  

Xpertec Solutions is a premium consultants and recruitment solution provider with customers and operations all over Sweden. Our mission is to connect businesses with skilled professionals who can contribute to their growth and success. With our extensive network and industry expertise, we streamline the recruitment process and save businesses time and effort.
  
  

**About the role:**  

We are hiring an electrical engineer to design and implement complex industrial, commercial, and domestic electrical systems. The role includes responsibilities to analyse existing electrical systems and making cost-effective improvements, conducting research, designing testing methods, completing quality assurance, inspecting the equipment, running diagnostics, as well as training new hires. You should ensure projects are completed on time and to specifications.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Designing, maintaining, implementing, or improving electrical instruments, facilities, components, equipment products, or systems for industrial, commercial, or domestic purposes
  
Performing a wide range of engineering tasks by operating computer-assisted design or engineering software and equipment
  
Conferring with customers, engineers, and others to discuss existing or potential engineering products or projects
  
Ensuring that installation and operations conform to standards and customer requirements by preparing electrical systems specifications, technical drawings, or topographical maps
  
Establishing construction, manufacturing, or installation standards or specifications by performing a wide range of detailed calculations
  
Ensuring compliance with specifications, codes, or customer requirements by directing or coordinating installation, manufacturing, construction, maintenance, documentation, support, or testing activities
  
Writing reports and compiling data regarding existing and potential electrical engineering projects and studies
  
Preparing specifications for purchases of electrical equipment and materials
  
Supervising or training project team members
  
Estimating material, labour, or construction costs for budget preparation
  
Maintaining electrical equipment
  
Working with a variety of technicians
  
  

**Education & Experience:**  

Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering degree from an accredited school
  
Practical experience with CAD software
  
Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities
  
Experience in using or a desire to learn the required software
  
Knowledge of applicable codes related to electronic engineering
  
Proficient in design and calculation software
  
Proven knowledge of engineering design software and equipment
  
Ability to design, implement, install and maintain electrical systems
  
  

**Preferred Skills:**  

Demonstrate strong leadership abilities and organizational skills
  
Passionate about engineering developments and able to efficiently troubleshoot systems
  
Excellent analytical skills
  
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
  
Attention to detail
  
Knowledge of electronic engineering codes
  
Ability to write technical reports and documentation
  
  

**What we offer:**  

We offer an enriching and lucrative opportunity for the next step in advancement of your career. We take pride in matching a role that suits your skill set and serves the need of our client. We support a balanced and well-adjusted work lifestyle, flexible work locations and hybrid working options.
  
  

Be inspired to grow within the role, experience the freedom to be yourself and the ability to watch your ideas come to life. We encourage transparent communication.

title: Supplier Quality Engineer - Gothenburg
description:
We are currently seeking a highly skilled Supplier Quality Engineer (SQE) with a solid background in electronics, and ideally, specific experience in wiring harness systems. This role requires an individual who is not only technically proficient but also a true team player—someone who brings energy and positivity to the team, helping to drive collaborative success.
  
**Position Duration:** 6 months, with a strong potential for extension based on performance and project needs.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

As an SQE, you will play an essential role in evaluating and supporting Volvo’s suppliers to ensure their capabilities align with our quality standards. Your role will include:
  
  

**Evaluating Supplier Capability:** Assess suppliers’ potential in various aspects to determine if they meet Volvo's standards. This requires a thorough understanding of critical production technologies and quality standards, especially in electronic components.
  
  

**Providing Specialized Expertise:** Supporting Supply Quality Engineers and other stakeholders by applying deep knowledge of specific production technologies to evaluate suppliers’ ability to deliver quality products.
  
  

**Project Leadership:** Managing large, complex projects or processes end-to-end with minimal oversight, while maintaining a proactive approach in troubleshooting and resolving challenging issues.
  
  

**Coaching and Mentoring:** Guiding and reviewing the work of junior team members, helping to develop skills within the team.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

We are looking for an individual with advanced experience in Supplier Quality, ideally with expertise in electronics and wiring harnesses. Education and work experience in electrical, mechanical, software engineering, or other relevant fields is expected. A specialist-level understanding of supplier quality areas, including electrical and surface treatment, is highly desirable.
  
If you’re ready to bring your expertise and positive attitude to a leading global company with the possibility of a longer-term career, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Process Engineer
description:
**About Nordic Bio-Graphite:**  

Nordic Bio-Graphite helps industries transition toward a net-zero future by supplying CO2-neutral graphite. Graphite is the largest component in EV batteries and a critical material for green steel production. However, traditional production methods emit up to 20 kg of CO2 per kg of graphite. Based on a patent-pending solution from research at KTH Sweden, we have developed the first process to produce fossil-free graphite from bio-based materials at scale. Within four years, NBG aims to prevent over 200,000 tonnes of CO2 emissions annually.
  
  

**Job Summary:**  

We are seeking a skilled R&D Process Engineer to join our team in advancing the sustainable production of bio-graphite. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in materials science, chemical engineering, or mechanical engineering, preferably with specialized experience in biomass thermal conversion processes, such as pyrolysis or gasification, and a deep understanding of material characterization and gas analysis. This role is central to scaling our proprietary bio-graphite production process and refining its environmental and operational efficiencies.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Design, plan, and conduct experiments on biochar thermal conversion to optimize pyrolysis and gasification processes within our production of bio-graphite.
  
Conduct comprehensive material characterization and gas analysis to assess conversion efficiency, material properties, and quality of bio-graphite.
  
Collaborate closely with our research team to refine the catalytic process for transforming biochar into high-purity, carbon-negative graphite suitable for battery and industrial applications.
  
Utilize ASPEN or similar process modeling software for process optimization and scale-up studies, developing models to predict performance and validate process designs.
  
Lead the integration of process improvements from experimental findings to pre-pilot and pilot plant setups.
  
Maintain accurate records and documentation of experimental protocols, results, and analysis for reporting and patent application support.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Master’s or Ph.D. in Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
  
Demonstrated experience with biomass thermal conversion processes such as pyrolysis, gasification, or similar methodologies, ideally in an industrial R&D setting.
  
Expertise in materials characterization techniques (e.g., BET, XRD, SEM) and gas analysis.
  
Knowledge of process modeling using ASPEN or similar software is a strong advantage.
  
Strong analytical skills with a data-driven approach to process improvement.
  
Excellent collaboration and communication skills for cross-functional work with internal teams and external partners.
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
At Nordic Bio-Graphite, you will be a crucial player in an early startup shaping the future of sustainable materials in high-impact industries. You will contribute to critical advancements in our green graphite production technology, working alongside industry-leading researchers and engineers. This role offers a unique opportunity to apply your expertise to a mission-driven company that addresses the global demand for sustainable, fossil-free graphite solutions.

title: Test Engineer (Mechanical or Electrical)
description:
**About Piab Group:**  

At Piab Group, we enhance our customers' productivity, sustainability, and safety through evolving industrial automation and have been doing so since 1951. We believe in an automated world where no resources are wasted, and no humans are injured. With annual sales of ~3 billion SEK and more than 1400 employees, Piab is a global organization, serving customers in more than 100 countries from a vast network of subsidiaries and channel partners. Since 2018, Piab Group has been owned by Patricia Industries, part of Investor AB. Piab serves a wide range of industries, including e-commerce logistics, food and beverage, pharmaceuticals, and automotive, providing innovative vacuum automation solutions tailored to each sector.
  
  

As a Test Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our mechatronic vacuum products. You will collaborate with a dynamic team to build test platforms, write test applications, and document test cases, contributing to our mission of advancing automation.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Conduct regression testing of mechatronic vacuum products.
  
Develop and build physical test platforms.
  
Write test applications using Python.
  
Create and document comprehensive test cases.
  
Together with the software team validate new products
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Proven experience in regression testing.
  
Proficiency in programming, particularly in Python.
  
Self-motivated with the ability to set and achieve personal goals.
  
Strong team player with a willingness to learn new skills.
  
Solid understanding of Physics and Mathematics.
  
Basic knowledge of electronic design principles.
  
2-5 years of relevant experience and a strong willingness to learn and adapt is more crucial than extensive experience.
  
To apply you must reside in Sweden and hold a valid work permit.
  
  

We offer a goal-oriented environment where the path to success is determined by your creativity and problem-solving skills. This role provides you with the freedom to be independent, find your own innovative solutions, and truly showcase your creativity.
  
  

**You can expect the following from us:**  

**Innovative Culture:**  Be part of a team that thrives on creativity and innovation.
  
**Global Impact:**  Work with a company that is a world leader in vacuum transport solutions.
  
**Global Presence:**  Piab has 25+ sales offices and over 900 partners worldwide, ensuring a vast network and global reach.
  
**Sustainable Vision:**  Contribute to an automated world, promoting safety and efficiency.
  
**Professional Growth:**  Access opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement.
  
**Diverse and Inclusive:**  Join a workplace that values diversity and fosters an inclusive environment.
  
**Stable Employer:**  As part of Patricia Industries and connected to the Wallenberg family, Piab benefits from strong support and a commitment to long-term growth and sustainability.

title: Automation Engineer
description:
Job Description

**Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?**

**Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.**


As a Senior Automation Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation and optimization of our manufacturing processes through the maintenance, troubleshooting, and improvement of our control systems, automation equipment, and instrumentation.


You will also be responsible for working with the automation team to provide programming, troubleshooting, and the maintenance of programmable logic controller (PLC) systems in our state-of-the-art manufacturing facility. Your experience and foundation in PLC programming and industrial automation will contribute to optimizing production processes, ensuring efficient equipment performance, and maintaining high-quality standards.

**How you will contribute**


You will ensure that delivered services are optimized to meet business demands and the service operations strategy, plan, measure, report and communicate service improvement initiatives, and serve as a consultant on issues and resolutions. You will also recommend actions that can be taken to optimize investments and benefits and to mitigate risks. This role will require you to identify suppliers, evaluate them, on-board new vendors, establish and run vendor governance; collaborate with management and follow-up on requisitions, purchase orders, invoices, and payments; work with project resources to provide design collateral and to configure software components so they are aligned with security policy and governance; and ensure adherence to development and configuration standards and processes.


You will:

* **Maintenance and Troubleshooting:** Assist electricians with routine maintenance, repair, and calibration of control systems, automation equipment, and instrumentation to ensure their reliability and accuracy. Troubleshoot and diagnose issues in a timely manner, employing analytical skills and technical expertise to minimize downtime and optimize production efficiency.

* **System Optimization:** Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineers and production personnel, to identify opportunities for system improvements and implement modifications to enhance productivity, quality, and safety. Proactively suggest enhancements to control strategies, automation processes, and instrumentation systems to maximize operational effectiveness.

* **Documentation and Reporting:** Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, repairs, and modifications performed, following established documentation procedures. Generate reports on equipment performance, failures, and improvements, providing valuable insights to inform decision-making processes and support continuous improvement efforts.

* **Preventive Maintenance:** Execute planned preventive maintenance programs for control systems, automation equipment, and instrumentation. Anticipate potential equipment issues and take proactive measures to prevent breakdowns.

* **Safety and Compliance:** Adhere to safety guidelines, company policies, and regulatory requirements related to controls, automation, and instrumentation. Identify and mitigate potential hazards, implement safety measures, and actively participate in safety initiatives and training programs.

* **Training and Knowledge Sharing:** Stay updated with the latest technological advancements, industry best practices, and emerging trends in controls, automation, and instrumentation. Share knowledge and expertise with team members, promoting a culture of continuous learning and development.

* Develop and implement PLC programs and control strategies to automate manufacturing processes and improve overall efficiency.

* Program, configure, and troubleshoot PLC systems, human-machine interfaces (HMIs), and other industrial automation devices to ensure proper operation and integration with existing equipment.

* Conduct routine maintenance, diagnostics, and repair of PLC systems, including identifying and resolving electrical, mechanical, and programming issues.

* Monitor and analyze production data, system performance, and equipment feedback to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions.

* Provide training and support to operators and maintenance personnel on PLC programming, troubleshooting techniques, and safe handling of automation equipment.

**More about this role**

**Work schedule: 100%**

No Relocation support available

We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!*Our people make all the difference in our succes*
