title: QA Engineer
description:
At Coody, we're revolutionizing consulting by combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment. With us, you'll receive a maxed out salary with a full benefit package, the opportunity to work remotely and assignments that are both fun and challenging.


On average, joining Coody means increasing your salary by 44%. How do we do it?


The math is simple. We pay you more by cutting unnecessary costs — no overpaid bosses, no luxurious conferences, and no fancy offices. Instead, we invest in what matters: you.


Coody is all about giving you as an individual the chance to have a free and flexible life to live for your own priorities. Welcome to Gravity Free Consulting.

### **Gravity Free Consulting @ Coody Means:**

* Maximized Compensation: Typically a 44% salary increase.
* Safety & Comfort: Employment with a generous benefits package.
* Freedom & Flexibility: No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
* Shaping the Future: Assignments with industry innovators like Topgolf, Spotify, Tobii, Volumental, Paradox, Volvo Cars, Varjo, and exciting startups and scale-ups.

 **ABOUT US**


Coody is a growing and dynamic group of people who are the tech stars of the future. We consists of about 13 different nationalities and work on assignments for digital game changers across Sweden, Finland, USA and the UK, in industries such as EV, Gaming, AI, MedTech, AR and FinTech.


We’re more than a company — we’re a community platform. Our approach is built on trust and autonomy. We keep corporate bullshit to a minimum and focus on what benefits our consultants most. Explore our employee handbook for more insight into a genuine supportive, consultant-first environment.

 **WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING**


As a QA Engineer consultant you'll work on technically, intellectually challenging and fun assignments for companies to strengthen their teams and projects.


You’ll be an integral part of the organisation and expected to contribute to well tested and launch ready products and applications to match users and stakeholders requirements. You're also an important person to automate the test-cycle.


You'll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see new challenges and situations as opportunities for growth. Typically, you'll work on 1-2 different assignments per year for companies in a sector you're passionate about.

 **WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR**

* 5+ years of experience working as a QA Engineer
* Deep understanding of one or more technical areas stated below
* Fluency in English (verbal and written)
* Experience working in an agile environment
* A doers mindset with a proven track record of getting things done

 **WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE THAT YOU HAVE**

**Background** in building test frameworks and test cases for apps, web, backend, infrastructure or embedded

**Experience** with testing tools such as Selenium, Gtest, Pytest, Appium, Scripting etc.

**Technical expertise** in both at least a couple of programming languages together with version control and other common tools like Git, Gitlab, CVS, Subversion, Jira, Confluence

**A Solid understanding** of CI/CD pipelines

**Knowledge** about requirement management towards software developers and other stakeholders

**A degree** in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field


If Gravity Free Consulting at Coody aligns with your goals, and you bring the skills we're seeking, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today, and we’ll get back to you within a week if your profile fits our needs.

title: System Test Engineer
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Office**Job Description**

**About Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc.**


Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is a world-class company with a global presence, dedicated to enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner, and safer. As a leading life sciences company, we are driven by our values of Integrity, Intensity, Innovation, and Involvement. With over 100,000 colleagues, we work together as one team to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation, and support patients in need. At Thermo Fisher Scientific, we value diverse experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's contributions are respected and celebrated.

**Discover Impactful Work**


This position is based on our site in Uppsala, where Thermo Fisher develops, manufactures, and market complete blood test systems to support the clinical diagnosis and monitoring of allergy, asthma, and autoimmune diseases. With 1,900 employees worldwide working with these products, and 1,000 in Sweden, we are the global leader in in-vitro allergy testing and the European leader in autoimmunity diagnostics.

**System Test Engineer Opportunity**
------------------------------------


We are offering an opportunity for a System Test Engineer to join our Large Instruments engineering team in Uppsala. The Large Instruments team currently consists of 9 employees and 2 contractors with the overall design responsibility of our Phadia™ 250, Phadia™ 1000 and Phadia™ 2500 Series in-vitro diagnostics instruments. Our highly dedicated team has a wide variety of knowledge spanning from electrical and mechanical engineering to verification, assay, software and more.


As a System Test Engineer, you will play a vital role in ensuring the optimal performance of our advanced systems. Your proven experience in testing and resolving complex system issues will significantly contribute to the success of our products in the market.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* This role consists of working closely with our supplier in East Asia (Japan) with upgrades and updates of our current instruments.
* Be part of development and breakdown of requirements for the controller software.
* Participate in development projects with our supplier to develop new versions of the controller software.
* Plan, perform and document actual testing of the controller software of the instruments.
* Perform and support technical investigations, tests and verifications of various types related to our instruments.
* Conduct system-level testing of our products to ensure their functionality and performance meet the highest standards
* Collaborate closely with different teams to develop test plans and strategies
* Identify and address issues while adhering to our documentation procedures
* Design and conduct test cases, ensuring thorough coverage of system requirements
* Continuously improve testing methodologies and processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness
* Offer technical assistance to individuals and organizations both within and outside of the company.

**Requirements**
----------------

* Bachelor´s or Master´s degree in Software/Electronics Engineering or a similar relevant background.
* Experience from working with sophisticated products consisting of software, mechanics and electrical interfaces, preferably with in-vitro diagnostics instruments and/or other types of medical devices.
* Product development experience, preferably of similar products types.
* It´s a plus with experience from system verification (planning, coordination and/or execution)
* Team player with ability to work in a global environment with multiple interfaces and people with various competencies.
* Strong written and verbal communications.
* Good English skills is essential since communication interfaces for this role are global.


If you are an engaged System Test Engineer looking to make a significant impact in a world-class company, we invite you to apply today. Join us at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where your expertise and dedication will be valued and rewarded.

**General conditions**
----------------------


Work Schedule: Standard (Mon-Fri)

**Location**
------------


This position is based in our office in Uppsala, Sweden.

**Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com**
---------------------------------------------

title: Infrastructure Engineer - Cloud, Data & AI
description:
**About Redeploy Insight**
 At Redeploy Insight, we specialize in building modern cloud data platforms to serve clients across the Nordics to enable enterprise-scale analytical capabilities. Our core focus lies in delivering cutting-edge solutions, including consulting expertise, managed services, and SaaS Data & AI platforms. We take pride in our strategic partnerships with industry leaders such as Microsoft & Databricks, positioning ourselves at the forefront of technological innovation.
   

  

 Redeploy Insight has successfully delivered large-scale and innovative data platforms to Electrolux, Coop, Folksam, PostNord, and Handelsbanken to name a few. Our dedicated team is passionate about enabling enterprise-scale analytical capabilities, empowering our clients to gain profound insights and make informed, impactful decisions.
   

  

 The demand for cloud based analytical platforms is constantly growing and we are now looking for a Infrastructure Engineer to join our growing team in Stockholm or Gothenburg. You will work in a fast-paced environment where you will collaborate with some of the most brilliant minds in the field and contribute to the evolution of our platforms with your expertise in Infrastructure Engineering.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an Infrastructure Engineer specializing in Cloud, Data & AI, you will be part of our Analytics Infrastructure team who provide tailor-made Data Analytics solutions together with our clients.
   

  

 In this role, you will be combining people, processes and technologies to ensure that the needs of each of our individual customers are met. Other than that, you will be working hands-on with solutioning, building, implementing, automating and optimizing our clients Data & Analytics solutions, mainly within Azure. With your expertise, you will enable our customers to work in a more data & ai-driven manner.
   

  

 You can expect to be working with diverse and exciting projects that will expand your knowledge across various companies and industries, as well as working with modern tools and data platforms.
   

  

**To be considered for the role, we see that you come with the following experiences and skills:**
* Engineering degree in Computer Science or Software Development
* Experience in designing, implementing, and managing Azure cloud Data Landing Zone or AI -solutions, such as Retrieval augmented generation (RAG)
* Experience with API development, preferably AI service APIs
* Experience with containerization, such as Docker and Kubernetes
* Familiarity with networking, virtualization, and storage technologies within Azure
* A solid understanding of infrastructure-as-code concepts and experience with tools like Bicep and Terraform
* Programming knowledge of one or more of either Python, Node.js, Go, Powershell, Shell or YAML
* Up-to-date with the latest Azure services and industry trends to recommend and implement improvements, including but not limited to Azure Databricks, Data Lake and Azure Data Factory, Azure Open AI, Azure AI Search
* Fluency in English with good written and communication skills


**And if you come with following experiences, we’ll be thrilled!**
* Preferably Azure certifications such as Azure Administrator Associate or Azure Solutions Architect
* Preferred experience in technical consulting projects


**Who are you?**
* A person with passion to innovate and design new products and help customers to find best possible solutions to their needs
* Passionate about solving challenging and analytical and infrastructure problems in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment
* Confident in yourself and your own abilities, but also open to learning new things and embracing new challenges


**You would like to work with us if you..**
* Want to work with the latest technology and projects within Analytics & AI
* Are motivated by customer challenges
* Want a fun and developing work and a workplace with good cohesion and atmosphere.
* Want to have the opportunity to impact your own development


**How To Apply**
 If you're ready to launch your career and make a meaningful impact on organizations through your passion for Infrastructure Engineering, then don’t hesitate to send in your application by hitting the apply button.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

***Note** 
 : To be eligible for the role you need to be based in Stockholm, Gothenburg or Jönköping, or have plans to relocate to either of the locations.*

title: Data & Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**About Improvin'.**
 How would you like to make your mark? Do you want to help make the food industry more sustainable, field by field?
   

  

 Improvin’ exists to tackle one of the world's largest challenges: how to producing more food, more sustainably. Our solution focuses on primary production, the source of over 70% of the food industry’s emissions. We help food brands and processors to measure, report, and reduce the climate impact of their value chains.
   

  

 Our mission is both vital and urgent, demanded by consumers, legislators, and progressive food companies.
   

  

**About The Role.**
 As a Machine Learning Engineer at Improvin’, you’ll play a key role in building a platform that helps companies in the food industry lower their climate footprints. We’re looking for someone dedicated to creating value and improving the day-to-day lives of our users. For that, you’ll need a strong belief in our mission and a passion for building data products – everything from developing and maintaining ETL flows and our data lake to working hands-on with large datasets, building machine learning models, and integrating with our web platform.
   

  

 Machine learning will be increasingly used across our platform. Computer vision and remote sensing, such as field boundary and crop type detection, are already key areas and will continue to be important. Predictive models are also a major part of our future, with existing examples including yield prediction.
   

  

 You'll receive competitive compensation, 30 days of paid vacation, and a pension. We’ll strive to provide all the tools necessary for you to excel and support your professional growth as our fast-scaling business evolves.
   

  

**About The Team.**
 We use English as our working language. Our hybrid work setup is flexible, but we expect you to come into the office on a weekly basis. We accept applicants from both inside and outside the EU, and we’ll do our best to support your transition.
   

  

 Most importantly, we believe that a diverse workforce is essential to our success. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all employees feel valued, respected, and supported, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, age, or disability.
   

  

 How you make impact.
   

  

* Develop and maintain data-focused products and machine learning models with an emphasis on performance and availability.
* Design and implement scalable, reliable, and secure data processing pipelines, storage solutions, and databases.
* Monitor and troubleshoot data platform issues, implementing solutions to prevent future problems.
* Own and implement data security and privacy policies, including access control, encryption, and data masking
* Collaborate with software engineers, analysts, designers, C-level executives, and other stakeholders to understand data needs and develop solutions.


 We believe you have.
   

  

* Passion and drive to build high-quality data-focused products, with proven involvement in end-to-end product development.
* Approximately 5+ years of experience building scalable, reliable, and easy-to-maintain data products.
* Preferably, a few years of experience in machine learning or MLOps projects.
* A proactive approach to identifying pain points, risks, and opportunities in an iterative development process.
* Good communication skills and a commitment to close collaboration with colleagues.
* Experience contributing actively to a team’s continuous work toward a shared technical vision.
* Experience with cloud-based solutions, orchestration, and containers.
* A strong willingness to learn, receive feedback, and a desire to grow both personally and professionally alongside your team.


 By applying, you'll have the opportunity to join a purpose-led, passionate, and international team.

title: Development Engineer Test and Simulation
description:
Scania is one of the world's leading manufacturers of trucks, buses and industrial motors and is a dynamic and safe employer. Become a part of it!
   

  

**About Us**
 The ERTRD Group, responsible for durability testing of chassis components and cabs, currently consists of 16 individuals, including both mechanics and engineers. They collaborate to achieve the group's goals and support each other.
   

  

 We are currently seeking a test engineer for the group, someone with an interest in vehicles, durability, and vibration issues. This engineer will be involved in exciting projects related to electrification and the development of a new cab program that we are facing in the coming years.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with internal customers to plan test assignments.
* Execute tests alongside our mechanics, both in rigs and vehicles.
* Analyse test results and contribute to improved design solutions, adding value for our customers.


**Your profile**
 You'll actively contribute to developing the group's methods and processes, continuously striving for improvement. If you enjoy taking ownership of tasks, solving problems, and working in a supportive team, we believe you'll thrive with us.
   

  

**We also think you have:**
* A degree in Mechanical Engineering, Engineering Physics, or a related field, or you have equivalent experience.
* Previous experience in testing, design, or calculation is desirable.
* Knowledge of durability is a strong asset.
* You have good knowledge of the Swedish language or if not you are willing to learn within your first year at Scania, since it is important to speak Swedish with some of our stakeholders.


 As for your personality, you are analytical, outgoing, adept at building networks.
   

  

**We offer**
* We offer you a strong product knowledge base, which will enable you to conduct valuable tests for our internal customers.
* You'll also build a broad network within R&D, including connections with design, calculation, and other testing groups.
* Additionally, you'll gain insights into how our components and subsystems perform in customer operations.


 For Scania the professional development of our employees is a priority, so education via internal and external courses is encouraged and supported. In addition to career and development opportunities, we can offer you other benefits such as free training at Scania's health center Gröndal or a wellness allowance. You will also be offered performance bonuses, an occupational pension, flexible working hours, the opportunity to lease a car through the company and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we also offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Jobexpress.  We can also offer other benefits such as up to a month of distance working within the EU per year, company car, company-performance bonuses, a pension, flexible working hours and possibility to work from our Hubs in Stockholm city or in Kungens kurva.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and relevant education certificates, please answer the questions stated when you sumit your application. Apply as soon as possible but no later than 2024-11-20. Ongoing selection and competency-based interviews will take place during the application period, therefore the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may will be conducted for this position.
   

  

**If you have any questions or want to know more, please contact:**
 Niklas Karlsson, senior engineer, niklas.karlsson@scania.com or Mikaela Johansson, group manager, mikaela.johansson@scania.com
   

  

 We are looking forward to reading your application!

title: Staff Data Engineer (Fintech team) (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
Senior Backend Developer (.NET)
description:
MAJORITY is a groundbreaking all-in-one digital financial service app that includes an FDIC-insured account, Visa® Prepaid card, money remittance, and international calling. We are built for migrants, by migrants.
   

  

 Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are following their dreams, love or new experiences, more and more of us are leaning towards new environments. Our purpose at MAJORITY is to empower the amazing, the brave, and the talented and help them achieve all of their ambitions.
   

  

 We believe that everyone deserves the same opportunity to succeed. Our mission is to provide migrants the tools to thrive in their new country.
   

  

 We are a diverse group of people from over 40 different countries that come together every day and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances
   

  

 MAJORITY is looking for a Senior Backend Engineer (.NET) to join its Engineering team. This is a full time, in-person position based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**About MAJORITY Backend**
 We’re a diverse bunch of skilled software developers with a passion for technical excellence. We strive to create innovative solutions to the many varied business problems that we are presented with. We work hard, deliver fast, are continually learning and have fun along the way. With a team of 12 backend developers we have built a system of nearly 60 microservices with a million lines of C# code. Our business is growing fast and therefore so is our need to continually scale the system to meet the growing number or users and transactions.
   

  

* We have a modern technical platform. Recently upgraded to .Net8.
* We have a microservice architecture, fully in C#. built on a solid foundation of base functionality like observability, DI, messaging etc.
* We have a high pace of development, shipping major new features frequently.
* We have leadership who understands and prioritizes technical work.
* We work in a domain (fintech) where correctness matters. We have very high uptime and correctness requirements. No payments should fail, and no cent can be lost!


****Key Responsibilities****
* Design, develop and maintain microservices built with .NET Core
* Write clean code with proper test coverage to support CI/CD workflows
* Contribute in design and architecture decisions within the team and across the organization
* Develop scalable, performant, and reliable systems
* Participate as a team member in agile deliveries
* Identify bugs and bottlenecks and resolve issues efficiently


****Requirements****
* You have 10+ years of experience working with modern backend development practices, with focus on .NET Frameworks and C#.
* You have good experience in cloud environments
* You have good experience working with SQL databases
* You are familiar with working with microservices & event driven architecture
* You have an understanding and interest in building and maintaining microservices running in Kubernetes
* You have experience with build tools and services such as AzureDevops


****About you****
* You're smart and you get stuff done
* You are ambitious, have a positive energy and always find a solution
* You can prioritize speed without neglecting quality and understand that speed is a competitive advantage
* You have a strong sense of ownership and accountability
* You are eager to learn from others and share what you know
* You dare to make decisions and learn from your mistakes
* You can reason through the trade-offs to make correct decisions for the benefit of the organization
* You have great communication skills in English


 Looking to be challenged? To work in an environment where your opinions are welcome and you’re constantly learning? To have a real impact on a meaningful project? To work with the latest technologies and to help shape the technology direction of the organization? Then we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 We are MAJORITY. We are international, ambitious, kind, and inclusive. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Backend Developer
description:
**Are you passionate about creating a great gaming experience and developing a scalable product?** 
**Come help us build the best geography game! You will be a part of a team with huge impact, shaping the experience for our amazing 85 million players.**
 At GeoGuessr we do more than create games, since 2013, we have crafted a game that turns the world into a playground for the curious and knowledge-hungry. During the last couple of years we have focused on building an incredible team, now just over 60 people, and craft new ways for our dedicated players to experience our fantastic geography games. GeoGuessr is widely played all around the world and have a large and dedicated community.
   

  

**The role**
 We're looking for a backend developer to join our tech organisation. You will be part of a cross-functional team responsible for delivering our new mobile game. The team consists of five Unity developers, a PO and three designers, all working together. At this stage we need to focus on implementing a backend solution. We are looking for someone who thrives in this highly explorative and fast-paced stage.
   

  

 We currently have an existing backend environment for the rest of the product, which we plan to use for our new game as well. This means you’ll collaborate with the rest of the organization when making adjustments. Although your main focus will be creating a backend solution for the game, you need to share our big-picture mindset and willingness to work on whatever is necessary to keep product development moving at the desired pace.
   

  

**What We Hope You’ll Bring**
* Min 5 years of experience with C#, in various projects.
* Broad experience from different databases (Redis, MongoDB, Dynamo)
* Experience implementing APIs and understands the challenges of compatibility and version management with clients that cannot be updated.
* Familiarity with modern development concepts like CI/CD, testing, etc.
* Experience from working with modern web technologies in modern companies.
* A "doer" mentality, unafraid of taking ownership of backend implementation.
* Sense of when it's applicable for short-cuts, and when one needs to build a long-term solution.
* A university degree in computer science \*


**It's Extra Nice If You Bring**
* Experience from mobile games
* Unity experience


**Wait, there's more!**
 We're offering a package of perks to keep you charged up and ready to create wonders:
   

  

* Daily breakfast and lunch at the office.
* 6 weeks of vacation + 3 extra days off, for a well-deserved rest.
* Pension and insurance as per ITP1 guidelines.
* 50,000 SEK education benefit.
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance.
* A high energy and very much alive office.


 We encourage exercise during working hours. We provide a large selection of snacks and drinks for recovery. A home to simply enjoy.
   

  

 This role is based in Stockholm where we have invested in creating our unique home at Katarinavägen 17, in the glass house by Slussen.
   

  

* or equivalent experience, (Higher Vocational Education (Yrkeshögskola) may be sufficient only if compensated trough extensive work experience).

title: Game Developer
description:
At Coody, we're revolutionizing consulting by combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment. With us, you'll receive a maxed out salary with a full benefit package, the opportunity to work remotely and assignments that are both fun and challenging.
   

  

 On average, joining Coody means increasing your salary by 44%. How do we do it?
   

  

 The math is simple. We pay you more by cutting unnecessary costs — no overpaid bosses, no luxurious conferences, and no fancy offices. Instead, we invest in what matters: you.
   

  

 Coody is all about giving you as an individual the chance to have a free and flexible life to live for your own priorities. Welcome to Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

**Gravity Free Consulting @ Coody Means:**
* Maximized Compensation: Typically a 44% salary increase.
* Safety & Comfort: Employment with a generous benefits package.
* Freedom & Flexibility: No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
* Shaping the Future: Assignments with industry innovators like Embark, Spotify, Tobii, Volumental, Paradox, Mojang, Varjo, and exciting startups and scale-ups.


**About Us**
 Coody is a growing and dynamic group of people who are the tech stars of the future. We consists of about 13 different nationalities and work on assignments for digital game changers across Sweden, Finland, USA and the UK, in industries such as EV, Gaming, AI, MedTech, AR and FinTech.
   

  

 We’re more than a company — we’re a community platform. Our approach is built on trust and autonomy. We keep corporate bullshit to a minimum and focus on what benefits our consultants most. Explore our employee handbook for more insight into a genuine supportive, consultant-first environment.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
 As a Game Development Consultant at Coody, you'll work on technically and intellectually challenging, fun assignments that strengthen client teams and projects. You will gain experience from diverse assignments within the gaming industry, ranging from heart-pounding action games to captivating story-driven adventures. With us, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant contribution and bring your creative vision to life.
   

  

 You'll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see new challenges and situations as opportunities for growth. Typically, you'll work on 1-2 different assignments per year for companies in a sector you're passionate about.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience in software development
* Some experience from building experiences in gaming, VR/AR och similar
* Deep understanding of one or more technical areas stated below
* Fluency in English (verbal and written)
* Experience working in an agile environment
* A doer's mindset with a proven track record of getting things done


**WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE THAT YOU HAVE**
**Deep knowledge within at least one game engine, framework or programming language,** 
 for example; Unity, Unreal, C#, C++, Rust, JavaScript
   

  

**A degree** 
 in Computer Science, Engineering, Game Development, or a related field
   

  

 If Gravity Free Consulting at Coody aligns with your goals, and you bring the skills we're seeking, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today, and we’ll get back to you within a week if your profile fits our needs.

title: Backend Java Engineer – Shape the Future of Global Streaming
description:
Are you a experienced Java developer passionate about building scalable systems that reach millions of users globally? Join a cutting-edge team where your expertise will directly impact how people discover and enjoy their favorite audio content every day. If you’ve ever been curious about shaping the future of how the world listens, this role could be music to your ears.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 Immediate or by agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 As a backend engineer, you will work on developing and maintaining the infrastructure that drives users to sign up for our paid product. You will collaborate with other teams in R&D, Marketing, and Growth to strengthen our platform’s capabilities and support the growing demands of our product portfolio. Our goal is to create a user-centered, automated conversion experience that is consistent across multiple channels.
   

 You'll be part of a mission-driven team responsible for enhancing the experience of millions of users globally, from casual listeners to dedicated fans, working on features that resonate with a wide audience. Our platform handles millions of streams daily, and you'll contribute to optimizing systems that ensure seamless playback and discovery for users everywhere.
 


  


  

**Please note that to be considered for this position, your CV must be submitted in English!**



**Work tasks**
  
* Design and develop scalable backend systems, data models, and APIs on the Google Cloud Platform.
  
* Build and maintain Java services that support our content platform, enabling marketing operators and other internal teams to work efficiently.
  
* Serve as a technical leader, mentor, and key contributor within a cross-functional agile team.
  
* Work closely with engineers and product managers to tackle complex challenges and scale automation efforts for a more user-focused conversion experience.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* 5+ years of experience as a backend engineer, with a strong focus on Java.
  
* Solid understanding of computer science fundamentals and experience building scalable backend services.
  
* Experience with cloud-based development on platforms like GCP or AWS.
  
* Ability to design and develop APIs in close collaboration with stakeholders.
  
* Experience working in cross-functional teams and independently leading complex delivery initiatives.
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Experience working with large-scale streaming platforms
  
* Familiarity with technologies like gRPC, BigQuery, Bigtable, or other Google Cloud tools.
  
* Experience writing and operating distributed, high-volume services in production.
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role you are curious, solution-oriented, and passionate about developing scalable systems. You enjoy working in teams and are motivated by contributing to the company’s success and mission.**



  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Sabrin Kanone or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth2@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15108080

title: Scania I-talent 2025!
description:
For the ninth time, Scania is launching their very popular I-Talent Program! The I-Talent Program at Scania is an inspiring six-month journey designed for IT graduates with a passion for innovation and sustainability. Participants gain hands-on experience in a specialized IT role, benefit from training, and collaborate with teams in IT, sales, marketing, and R&D. The program not only boosts technical skills but also strengthens soft skills within a supportive network, preparing graduates to contribute to Scania's purpose - to drive the shift towards a sustainable transport system. As a participant in the I-Talent Program, you will join IT´s mission at Scania to utilize the power of software and data in all areas: an ideal launchpad for those ready to make a meaningful impact in the tech industry. If you will graduate in the spring of 2025 or have a maximum of 2 years of work experience in your IT career, this program is for you!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Scania CV Aktiebolag
 



  

**City :**
 Södertälje
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 September 2025
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
   




**About the role**

 Scania is one of Sweden’s largest companies and offers trucks and buses for heavy transport in combination with a wide range of product-related services. Their mission is to drive the transition to a sustainable transport system by developing a safe, smart and energy-efficient transport solutions that are better for both people and our planet. Today, Scania have around 50,000 employees in around 100 countries and together with partners and customers they are driving the transition towards a more sustainable transport industry and are both trend setters and pioneers in electrification and sustainable transport systems.
 


  


 Together with several other I-talents, you will be offered a unique chance to participate in a program that will kick-start your journey at Scania. You are employed in a specific role and belong to a team but alternate the work in your role with meetings together with the other I-talents. The program starts every fall and is designed for you who are new in your career and aim to give you the best possible conditions to grow into your role. I-talent Program consists, in addition to daily work in your team, mainly of three parts – “Learning your professional role”, “Go-and-see” and “Training”. This provides very good opportunities to build a good network within Scania and in addition to your I-talents colleagues and your closest manager, you will be assigned a buddy who will be there for you the first time. At Scania, you are offered a multicultural work environment with ambitious colleagues and a company that invests in leadership. There is room for everyone to grow here, regardless of whether you want to be a generalist, specialist, or a leader. If you have the right attitude and are motivated to take responsibility, you will have all chances to develop!
 


  

  

****Role descriptions****
  

  

  

  

  


  

**OBSERVE!**
 As we are recruiting for several roles at Scania, we want you to select the 2-3 roles that you are most interested in and emphasize this in your CV and cover letter. OBS 2: The advert can be updated with more roles the coming months.
 


  


  

**Data Engineer CAD/PLM Team**



  


 As a Data Engineer in Scania’s CAD/PLM team, you will be an essential part of a cross-functional team that develops and adapts the company's CAD/PLM platform. You will join an international and supportive team with great experience in welcoming new I-Talents. Here, you are offered a flexible and tech-focused role where your responsibilities will be adjusted according to current projects and needs. In the role, you will work closely with technology and innovation, with the opportunity to explore AI solutions and their applications in test automation. As part of this team, your work contributes to creating a stable and efficient CAD platform used by Scania's entire R&D department. You will primarily work with programming languages such as Java, C++, and SQL, but for those who are technically curious, there are the opportunities to explore other areas and technologies.
 


  


  

**Automation/SCADA Developer**



  


 As an Automation Engineer/SCADA Developer, you will be part of a group consisting of around 28 employees, both consultants and employees as well as some former I-talents! The group fulfills an important purpose in supporting the production systems in above all Södertälje, but also in other parts of the world where Scania has their production. The systems ensure, for example, that the operators know how to carry out the assembly and meet time schedules as planned. You will work in a broad role with both PLC programming, testing, configuration and participate in planning meetings for the projects. You will collaborate with for example both production staff, other automation engineers and architects. A suitable background for this role is, for example, an education in robotics and/or automation and preferably with knowledge in Git and SQL. You will be part of a team with a good collaboration where you share knowledge with each other and we are looking for you who take a lot of responsibility, wants to develop yourself and is curious to learn more about this field!
 


  


  

**CAD/CATIA-Platform Development**



  


 Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a dedicated truck manufacturer to offering sustainable and complete transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation, and Scania IT has embarked on an exciting journey of change to contribute to this development. Part of this change is to adapt the CAD and PDM section’s systems, and that is what you will be working on! Development is primarily done in C/C++ but, in the long term, also in Java, and we are looking for someone passionate about development and drawn to the challenge of bringing people and technology together to achieve the best results. You will be part of a large department and work in a role with many points of contact; this is a role for someone who thrives in an outgoing work environment where knowledge is shared among colleagues. You don’t need to know everything from the start – what’s most important is your ambition and desire to develop!
 


  


  

**Data Engineer / Data Scientist - Advanced Analytics Team**



  


 As a Data Engineer or Data Scientist in this team, you will be a central part of a cross-functional data science team of 14 people building AI solutions for various parts of Scania. You’ll be welcomed into an international and close-knit team where we value collaboration and curiosity. This role offers you the opportunity to work closely with the business, shaped by ongoing projects and business needs. To thrive with us, we hope you have a strong technical interest and a desire to understand the challenges and opportunities of the business. You will help make Scania data-driven by building models and data pipelines for AI solutions that provide direct business value. You will also have the chance to deepen your skills with tools and technologies such as AWS, Spark, SQL, and Databricks. For this team, we are looking for someone with a relevant master’s level education. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work closely with the business, directly impacting Scania’s results through innovative and value-creating AI applications.
 


  


  

**Developer - Product Development IT**



  


 As part of Product Development IT, you will be positioned between business and IT, working with products used by Scania's internal R&D, which partly consist of third-party solutions. The applications support everything R&D does in Embedded Software development and can include tools for managing development projects, requirement management tools, and procurement tools. All of these are related to various regulations, making these products very important from a safety perspective for Scania. For example, the risk analysis tool is used to analyze truck signals, how it is controlled, and what physical risks might arise to prevent accidents. You will also have a lot of contact with users to understand their needs and desires, and the products are primarily developed in Java, JavaScript, Python, and Velocity. You’ll be part of a social, multicultural team with approximately 10 other colleagues and your immediate manager, some of whom are former I-talents! You will work closely with others on the team, and they often arrange activities such as after-work gatherings, picnics, badminton, and other social activities outside of work. Beyond that, this is a team where everyone supports each other, takes collective responsibility, and shares knowledge. We are looking for someone with a strong interest in developing their programming skills, and if you also have knowledge (or a desire to learn) in DevOps, AWS, Gitlab, or CI/CD, that’s a plus but not a requirement. The most important thing is your willingness and commitment to grow!
 


  


  

**Network Engineer**



  


 As an infrastructure engineer, you will be part of the department that supports Scania’s industrial network across various production units, providing both services and expertise throughout the entire organization. The department includes around 40 employees, with our IUBC group currently consisting of 15 people. Your responsibilities will cover networking, LAN, WLAN, and network security. You will work closely with the business, offering technical expertise, configuring systems, troubleshooting issues, and developing technical solutions. Additionally, you will help maintain corporate standards and policies within this area. In this role, you’ll work with a broad range of technologies within complex IT environments, which is part of what makes the position so exciting. Scania is a large company with numerous users, and we believe this role is ideal for someone eager to gain a comprehensive understanding of how everything fits together from a technical standpoint. We expect you to have an educational background in IT/technology with a focus on networking and security, but the most important qualities are a willingness to learn, an open mind, and a strong sense of responsibility for your own growth!
   




**We are looking for**

 In this recruitment, we will place great emphasis on your personal qualities and your interest in both the position and Scania as a company. We are looking for committed and talented problem solvers who are happy to come up with new ideas about how things can be improved. You also have great cooperation skills and take responsibility for your own learning. If you do, there are endless opportunities to develop. For example, former I-talents now have both leadership and specialist roles!
 


  

  

****ATTENTION!****
  


 Be clear in your CV and personal letter which 2-3 roles you are mainly interested in and why.
 


  


  

**We are looking for candidates who have:**



  

  
* A post-secondary education in computer science, electronics, mechatronics, network engineering etc.
  
* Knowledge of one or more of the following areas: Java, C#, Kotlin, C++, C, TypeScript, Python, AWS, Spark, SQL, Databrick, network engineering, network security, LAN/WLAN. and PLC programming,
  
* Knowledge of frontend frameworks such as React, Angular or Vue
  
* Graduate in spring 2025 or has up to maximum 2 years of work experience when the program starts in september 2025
  
* Very good knowledge in English as it´s the primary language you will use in your daily work
  


  


  

**Merit**



  

  
* For some of the roles, it will be seen as a merit if you have knowledge in Swedish
  


  

  

****The recruitment process****
  

  
* Phone interview with Academic Work
  
* Tests (problem solving + personality)
  
* In-depth interview with Academic Work
  
* Interview with Scania (for some positions, you will also complete a programming test)
  
* References + decision
  
* Interviews with Scania will take place in Q4 2024 and Q1-Q2 2025.
  


  

  

  

  

  

  

****Other information****
  

  

  

  

  

  
* Start: September 2025
  
* Extent: Full-time, fixed-term employment for 6 months with a good chance of continue your career at Scania after the program
  
* Location: Södertälje and with the possibility of remote work a few days a week
  
* The recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and all questions regarding the process are handled by Academic Work.
  
* Contact details: Responsible recruitment consultants: Emelie Säfbom, emelie.safbom@academicwork.se, Milly Ellqvist Weidstam, milly.weidstam@academicwork.se and Johanna Sörell johanna.sorell@academicwork.se.
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Scania CV Aktiebolag**

 Read more about Scania on their website: https://www.scania.com/
   




**Get directly recruited to Scania CV Aktiebolag**

 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Jenny Rydberg or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv3@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15108450

title: Full-Stack Engineer
description:
**Company Overview**
*Pinpoint Estimates, a dynamic fintech company based in Stockholm, is dedicated to fostering transparency and democratising the stock market. We operate an open platform that leverages crowd-sourced financial estimates from independent analysts and private investors for companies listed on the Nordic stock exchanges.*
*In the last year, Pinpoint Estimates achieved significant milestones, tripling our data volume, launching our first integrations with other investor tools and becoming a standard for market expectations data used by financial media. However, our ambitions extend further – we aim to attract more users, expand into new markets and integrate with more tools and platforms. To achieve these goals, we are actively seeking smart and passionate individuals to join our team.*
**Responsibilities**
* Participate in development of a robust and scalable product architecture.
* Work closely with the CTO and other functions to align technology strategies with business goals.
* Drive innovation and provide technical expertise to shape the product roadmap.
* Develop, test and deploy software solutions. Our stack is React/Next.js, Node, PostgreSQL and AWS.
* Troubleshoot and debug issues across the stack, ensuring optimal application performance.
* Optimize and enhance existing code for scalability, performance and maintainability.


**What Do You Need To Succeed In This Role**
* Thrive in a quick-paced startup environment, making agile decisions to adapt to changing priorities.
* Evaluate and pivot technology strategies based on market trends and business needs.
* Be a self-starter who can work independently.
* Collaborate effectively with colleagues, the board and external partners.
* It is a plus if you have experience or interest in stock markets.


**Requirements**
* Technical Expertise: Proven experience as a full-stack developer, candidates proficient in front-end technologies and interest for back-end are also welcome. Understanding of system architecture, databases, and cloud computing is a bonus.
* Entrepreneurial Spirit: previous experience in a startup environment or a demonstrated entrepreneurial mindset. Ability to take calculated risks and make quick, strategic decisions.
* Communication Skills: Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
* Experience: 2+ years of experience in fullstack development or front-end development.


**For more information or questions please contact us at** 
 natasha@pinpointestimates.com

title: Data Engineer
description:
We’re passionate about helping our customers succeed and shaping the future of retail, fostering a collaborative and open environment where everyone’s voice is valued. As a Data Engineer, you’ll play a key role in developing and scaling our data platform. You’ll focus on building secure and efficient data pipelines, collaborating with analysts, product teams, and stakeholders to ensure our data infrastructure meets the evolving needs of our growing business.
 



  





**Must Have:** 



* Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
* 3+ years of experience in data engineering
* Proven experience building data pipelines and processing large data sets
* Experience with cloud platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure)
* Knowledge of Data Warehouse Automation and ETL tools (e.g., Dataform, DBT, Airflow, Matillion)
* Strong understanding of building high-quality solutions for analysts
* Passion for data processing applications
* Agile mindset and strong collaboration skills
* Interest in building and maintaining CI/CD systems



  





**Nice to Have:** 



* Knowledge of Git, Docker, Terraform, and Python
* Experience with transformation tools (Dataform or DBT)
* Familiarity with client logging
* Experience working with streaming data

title: Stockholm Full Stack Developer & Startup Founder (March, 2025)
description:
**Full Stack Developer & Startup Founder (March, 2025)**
**Note: This is no for full-time employment, but rather for the opportunity to build your own VC-backed startup!**
**Who You Are**
 You are a highly accomplished full-stack software developer with a demonstrated ability to deliver innovative solutions. Your exceptional programming skills and experience in building complex applications position you to tackle significant challenges within the tech industry. You possess a strong problem-solving aptitude and a passion for pioneering cutting-edge technologies. Driven to make a real impact, you're eager to leverage your expertise in building disruptive tech ventures.
   

  

**About Antler**
 Antler is the world's most active venture capital firm, providing funding from pre-seed to Series C. We invest in Founders who seek to define our tomorrow and reshape the world we live in with groundbreaking technological innovation. Every year, we handpick the strongest Founders from more than 135,000 applicants across our 27 locations on the globe, which has led us to work with more than 7,000 founders to date and a portfolio of more than 1,000 startups.
   

  

**The Antler Founder Residency**
 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week Residency. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
   

  

* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success.


**Program Details**
* Start Date: March 3rd, 2025
* Location: Onsite at our Stockholm office
* Compensation: While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* Visa Sponsorship: Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.


**For our March 2025 cohort, we’re looking for someone who:**
* Has the autonomy to develop sophisticated software solutions to address real-world challenges, merging ingenuity with functionality.
* Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, capable of breaking down complex issues and bringing structure into business cases
* Providing leadership, whether it’s directing a development team or managing comprehensive product delivery.
* You have an idea that you believe can solve a problem you are deeply interested in. You understand that you need co-pilots who share your vision and values.


**Application Process**
**Our Streamlined Application Process Takes Only 2-3 Weeks**
* Apply through our website.
* Participate in an introductory interview.
* Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
* Receive a potential offer.


**Antler Success Stories**
 Several Companies Built Through The Antler Program Have Received Pre-seed Investment And Have Gone On To Secure Significant Funding Rounds. Here Are Just a Few Examples
   

  

* Wingbits: A community-driven flight data tracking platform
* Two: A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* Evyon: A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* Glint Solar: Software accelerating the identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* PerPlant: AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

title: Fullstack utvecklare till innovativt SAAS bolag!
description:
Som fullstack utvecklare hos Visionera får du möjligheten att växa och utvecklas med tiden, tillsammans med duktiga och trevliga kollegor på det centralt belägna kontoret vid Odenplan. Du kommer få stor inblick i företaget och spela en viktig roll för den fortsatta tillväxtresa. För dig som trivs i en miljö fylld med innovation, energi och utmaningar är Visionera rätt plats!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Visionera Aktiebolag
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Visionera är ett innovativt mjukvaruföretag som utvecklar verksamhetsstödssystem för alla typer av företag och industrier. De har stor erfarenhet av att hjälpa sina kunder att effektivisera interna processer med olika former av IT-produkter och support. Visionera är idag ledande inom SAAS tjänster och erbjuder dessutom konsulttjänster i sin tjänst- och produktportfölj. Det är ett mindre företag med höga mål och stort hjärta. Beslutsvägarna är korta och du kommer att få en god inblick i hela företagets verksamhet där dina tankar och idéer värdesätts. Visioneras kunder finns över hela världen!
   

 ”På Visionera lär man sig något nytt varje dag, med högt i tak arbetar vi på att utvecklas tillsammans kontinuerligt. Man får också vara med och påverka direkt i en platt organisation och vara drivande i arbetet framåt med produkterna” - Mattias Larsson, Lead Developer
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En god introduktion, vidareutbildningar och mentor för att du på bästa sätt ska komma in i arbetet och utvecklas tillsammans med Visionera
  
* Ett jobb där ditt privatliv värdesätts. Vi tror att du mår som bäst och presterar som bäst när du får tid för träning, gaming, familj eller andra saker som just du brinner för.
  
* Visar du framfötterna är möjligheterna oändliga! Här kan du växa som person och i din roll, samt ta del av andra aspekter av produktutvecklingen. Det finns exempelvis möjligheter att på sikt arbeta som senior utvecklare, team lead, eller inom test eller UX design.
  
* Visionera säljer sin egen produkt vilket innebär att säljare och supporten sitter bredvid dig och därmed är du nära kunderna och ser produkten leva.
  


  


 Hos Visionera arbetar du med den egenutvecklade SAAS applikation, VisionFlow. Detta system används både av Visionera själva samt av kunderna i deras arbetsprocesser. VisionFlow är ett system för ITSM, ärendehantering och CRM som effektiviserar verksamheter och förenklar kommunikationen mellan avdelningar och team i en gemensamt lösning. VisionFlow kan även integreras med andra system vilket gör att det blir ännu mer kraftfullt. Tack vare VisionFlows konkurrenskraft är Visionera uppe och spelar med de större aktörer trots att de är ett mindre företag. Då systemet är stort och utvecklas från grunden in-house på Visionera, så kommer du som utvecklare sällan känna att du gör samma sak om och om igen trots att du arbetar med samma produkt. Här arbetar du projektbaserat med kundspecifika anpassningar av VisionFlow för att ge kunden den bästa lösningen för sin verksamhet och få ut så mycket som möjligt från sitt användande av VisionFlow.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Utveckla gränssnitt i Sencha EXT JS (ett Javascript ramverk)
  
* Utveckla ny funktionalitet i systemet, både på klient- och serversidan
  
* Arbeta med infrastruktur, drift och underhåll av systemlösningen tillsammans med kollegorna i DevOps-teamet
  
* Support och åtgärd av buggar
  
* Utveckla och förbättra mobilappen för systemet
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en avslutad civil- eller högskoleingenjörsexamen inom datateknik eller motsvarande område
  
* Har goda kunskaper i Java och JavaScript
  
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med databaser så som MSSQL och MySQL, samt en vilja att lära dig mer inom området
  
* Har grundläggande kunskaper av webbutveckling, CSS och HTML
  
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift då du använder dig av båda språken i ditt arbete
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Har minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet som systemutvecklare
  
* Har hobbyprojekt att visa upp
  
* Erfarenhet av infrastruktur eller intresse för att lära dig
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Målmedveten
  
* Stabil
  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Respektfull
  


  

  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**
  

  
* Personlighets- och probemlösningsstest (ca. 40 min)
  
* Telefonintervju med Academic Work (10- 15 min)
  
* Digital intervju med Academic Work (1 h)
  
* 1a intervju med Visionera (ca. 1h)
  
* Kodtest
  
* 2a intervju med Visionera (ca. 1h)
  
* Referenser + Beslut
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
